meanings.definition: Before the official release of a product or service.
meanings.sent1: The movie tickets sold out quickly prerelease.
meanings.sent2: We got a sneak peek at the game prerelease.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to open the treat bag prerelease, thinking it was dinner time.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed prerelease, surprising everyone with their early beauty.
meanings.sent5: The students eagerly awaited the prerelease of the new book.

meanings.definition: To release something before the official release date.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to prerelease the software to gather feedback.
meanings.sent2: They prereleased the song to build excitement among fans.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally prereleased the dessert before the main course.
meanings.sent4: The author prereleased a chapter of the book to tease readers.
meanings.sent5: The band prereleased the album online for their loyal followers.
